alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Taylor; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Jefferson; Inland Taylor; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Gulf, Wakulla, southern Liberty, southwestern Jefferson, Taylor, southeastern Leon, Franklin and southwestern Madison Counties through 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/... At 414 PM EDT/314 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mexico Beach to 7 miles northeast of Carrabelle to 13 miles south of Monticello. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodville, Carrabelle, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, St. Marks, Perry, Crawfordville, St George Island, Wakulla, Franklin, Sopchoppy, Cody, Honeyville, Wakulla Springs, St George Island St Pk, Medart, Perry-Foley Airport, Natural Bridge, Liveoak Island and Curtis Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
